snippet: City workers in Scranton will receive their full pay this week, the first paychecks since Mayor Christopher Doherty slashed their pay to minimum wage on July 6.
abstract: City workers in Scranton, Pa, will receive a full week's pay for the first time since July 6, when Mayor Christopher Doherty slashed their pay to minimum wage in order to make payroll in the cash-strapped city; whether the city will be able to continue paying full salaries depends on how much revenue it collects.
lead_paragraph: City workers in Scranton will receive their full pay this week, the first paychecks since Mayor Christopher Doherty slashed their pay to minimum wage on July 6.

headline.main: Pennsylvania: Full Pay Back in Scranton, for Now
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania: Full Pay Back In Scranton, For Now
